DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the present study was to examine, for pain relief during labor, the efficacy of two pharmacological approaches â€” the 0.125% ropivacaine alone and the 0.0625% ropivacaine added to 75 ug clonidine, both by epidural administration. The effect of the drugs on mother and newborn was also determined.
DOC.brief_title: Labor Analgesia With Ropivacaine and Clonidine
DOC.criteria: Singleton healthy Fullterm pregnancy American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status I or II Patients who had received opioids History of hypersensitivity to local anesthetic or to clonidine Fetus showed signs of possible intrauterine suffering Fetus showed signs of possible neurological deficit
